headline.main: FRANCE.; The Daily Times Interdicted by Government--Resignation of M. Persigny--Paris Gossip.

docs.lead_paragraph: The circulation of the NEW-YORK has been interdicted in France. The various measures of examination ion and mutilation of which it has been the object, and of which 1 have kept you in formed, will have prepared you for this step. The last package, by the Baltic containing four numbers, from Wednesday to Saturday, was kept back two Days, and then three papers out of the four were retained. Subscribers received the Wednesday's

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

headline.main: A Good Time among the Philadelphia Booksellers.; FESTIVAL TO MR. A. HART. Historical Notices of the Book-Publishing Business.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the Philadelphian North American, whose editor, Mr. MORTON McMICHAEL, was chairman of the occasion, we extract such portions of the speeches made at a festival to the publisher, Mr. A. HART, as are of most public interest. The health of Mr. HART having been proposed, that gentleman responded., Said he:

headline.main: LONG - ISLAND.; Street-Preaching in Williamsburg--Disturbanee-Seventeen Arrests.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. PARSONS and one of his associate street-preachers went to Williamsburg, where they held forth at 3 o'clock in the afternoon, at the junction of North Second and Fourth-streets. An audience of about 1,000 persons assembled to listen. Besides the police force present, there were 40 of the Sheriff's special deputies detailed to preserve the peace. Soon after 4 o'clock, there

docs.lead_paragraph: Election of Assistant Superintendents--Per-hum Gift Tickets Refused--Grading and Salaries. A Stated Meeting of this Board was held on Wednesday evening, at the Hall of the Board of Education, corner of Grand and Elm-streets. Dr. A. V. WILLIAMS, President, in the Chair, and a quorum present.

docs.lead_paragraph: It was our fortune to ride down upon the Long Island Railroad a day or two since--the very day that the fare to Greenport was raised from two dollars to two and a quarter. There was a good deal of complaint that the charge had not been advertised near as extensively as the fact that excursion trains would be run through the week.
